title: Cylinder Head - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Removal seat, battery, fuel tank, Engine, Cam Cover, Camshaft DP DPA DP2 DP3
Removal seat, battery, fuel tank D54; D64; D72; D92; DA2; DB; DB2; DBX; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DE; DF; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DZ

body.body: Engine Removal D64; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ
Engine Removal DP; DP2; DP3; DPA

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DPZ; D64; DP4; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP

body.body: D series 900 cc cylinder head removal from VIN818610 to 914447 (D54; D64; D92; DB2; DB4; DBX; DC; DCZ; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ; DZ; DZA)
Noting their position and the thickness of the shims, remove all eight shims from the cylinder head.
There are seven cylinder head bolts with hexagonal heads and one cylinder head bolt with a torx head.
The hardened washer for the torx bolt is slightly larger than the hardened washers for the remaining cylinder head bolts.
Note the position of the torx bolt and its washer for installation. It will only fit in its original position.
Progressively release the cylinder head bolts in the order shown below.
Remove the cylinder head bolts and washers. Keep two of the bolts for the step that follows, and discard the washers and remaining bolts.
If necessary, lightly tap the cylinder head with a soft-faced mallet to break the gasket seal.
Remove the cylinder head from the crankcase.
Remove and discard the cylinder head gasket.
Note the position of the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade upper mounting for installation.
Lift the camshaft drive chain tensioner rubbing blade out of the crankcase.
Camshaft drive chain tensioner rubbing blade
and the two kept cylinder head bolts to hold the cylinder barrel in position.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DPZ; DZ; DPA; DP; DBX; DCZ; D64; DB2; DZA; DC; DP2

body.body: D series 900 cc cylinder head removal up to VIN818609
Noting their position and the thickness of the shims, remove all eight shims from the cylinder head.
Progressively release the cylinder head bolts in the order shown below.
Remove the cylinder head bolts and washers. Keep two of the bolts for the step that follows, and discard the washers and remaining bolts..
If necessary, lightly tap the cylinder head with a soft-faced mallet to break the gasket seal.
Remove the cylinder head from the crankcase.
Remove and discard the cylinder head gasket.
Note the position of the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade upper mounting for installation.
Lift the camshaft drive chain tensioner rubbing blade out of the crankcase.

Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal

Engine - Removal

Remove the camshaft (see

There are seven cylinder head bolts with hexagonal heads and one cylinder head bolt with a torx head.
The hardened washer for the torx bolt is slightly larger than the hardened washers for the remaining cylinder head bolts.
Note the position of the torx bolt and its washer for installation. It will only fit in its original position.
Progressively release the cylinder head bolts in the order shown below.
Cylinder Head Bolt Release Sequence
Remove the cylinder head bolts and washers. Keep two of the bolts for the step that follows, and discard the washers and remaining bolts.
If necessary, lightly tap the cylinder head with a soft-faced mallet to break the gasket seal.
Remove the cylinder head from the crankcase.
Remove and discard the cylinder head gasket.
Note the position of the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade upper mounting for installation.
Lift the camshaft drive chain tensioner rubbing blade out of the crankcase.
